  • Articulate

2009

Articulate

Role: Design

Articulate: design that speaks was a collaborative exhibition by our senior design class. I was co-designer for the marketing material for the show, including posters and a postcard.

Symbols

The challenge was to create an art show that represented all 20 students in the class. The show's theme has to be broad enough to encompass everyone, but still be defined. The class conceptualized Articulate: design that speaks as a way to show how our work communicates with the viewer.

The idea was to take the word 'articulate' and give it a visual representation with brail, sign language, and materials we use in digital design. It's not only a literal representation of instruments of nonverbal communication, the symbols also represent the bridging of art, particularly the work in our show, and the viewer.

'Articulate' in Symbols

I saw the sign

After concept, the symbols were used in the poster and postcard design. A series of three posters were designed to add some variety. One postcard layout was made.

Posters
Postcard, Front & Back
